channel.title: M.2 on Machine Learning

item.title: M.2 Module Interface Connector
item.description: Concepts # def m.2 (now) # M.2 (pronounced “M dot two”) is a compact card or module form factor supporting multiple protocols and applications. It was developed by PCI-SIG and SATA-IO. The M.2 comes in two main formats: Connectorized, which includes a “card” (with pins) and a motherboard “socket (a.k.a. slot)” (with contacts) Soldered down m.2 vs. ngff (old) # M.2 was originally called the Next Generation Form Factor (NGFF).
